11311.content:
There were many books sitting on a shelf amongst the various curios, but seeing the title 'Jusenkyo Secrets' on the cover of one got Nabiki's attention. Even if the book turned out to have no good useful information for any of the various cursed martial artists in town, she should be able to extort a small fortune out of one or more of them for the information it contained. She smirked to herself - the book almost certainly had nothing that would help any of them, if history was any guide.

The shop owner noticed Nabiki's attention. "Ah, you are interested in legends of Chinese curses?"

"I have a passing curiosity, is all," Nabiki answered, trying to sound as disinterested as possible. "I've never seen this shop before, actually. Sort of strange, isn't that?"

"Not really, the shop wasn't here yesterday. The building was, of course, but I just opened for business today. Moved from Hokkaido to be closer to my grandchildren," he answered. He tilted his head sideways. "Strange how low the rent is here. Or how nervous the insurance man was about issuing a policy."

"I'll give you some free advice if you'll give me this book," Nabiki offered.

The owner laughed heartily. "Well, you have some nerve, don't you, young lady? Alright, let's hear your advice?"

"Under no circumstances should you allow the insurance salesman to talk you into not covering 'martial arts' related property damage," Nabiki said, clutching the book. "Trust me, that's why the rent is so low here."

The owner blinked. "How did you know he..." He shook his head. "Of course, you're a local. Thank you very much, miss...?"

"Nabiki Tendo."

"Miss Tendo, I appreciate your advice. Even if it will double my insurance costs."

"In the long run, it will save you money and pain," she said, sincerely. Just because she was greedy, didn't mean she was going to give bad advice, after all. "So, may I?"

"Oh, sure, sure. I've had that for thirty years, you're the first person to even look at it, actually," he answered.




Nabiki flipped through the pages on her way home. The book seemed to be a bust for the most part, at least at first. A chapter explaining what the curses were, and how one acquired one. Several more on tragic individual stories. Theories about how the pools of sorrow formed in the first place. But then the stuff actually worth some money to Nabiki began. Formulas for a few temporary treatments. A strong warning against mixing permanent curses. And then, bizarrely, a tea recipe. Nabiki flipped back, wondering why there was a tea recipe in there.

"If a cursed individual drinks a tea brewed with the essence of both his cursed and natural halves, and the essence of a second person, that cursed individual will be bound to obey the commands of the second person by the magic of the curse. Only the instinct of self-preservation will be able to override and break this power, as one unfortunate Chinese Warlord learned yadda yadda yadda," Nabiki read, her eyes dancing with Yen. "The Essence? I wonder... ah! A weaker, temporary form may be brewed using the hair (or scales, or whatever) instead of the essence, which may make it easier for the aspiring master to obtain the essence for the permanent form."

She tilted her head again. "Strange that Shampoo has never tried... ah! A warning that the victim may become infertile as a side effect. Another warning that the victim's intelligence and emotions are not affected, and victims will usually resent being controlled." Nabiki chuckled. "Well, she wants his babies, so that probably explains it."

She closed the book, and made her way towards her family home, pondering. It really made no difference to her if Ranma couldn't get anyone pregnant - especially if only she knew that fact. She smiled the entire way home, creeping out a few of her classmates who got a glimpse of her. It was time to make a little tea.

By the time Ranma woke up the next morning, the tape's effects were complete. She squirmed uncomfortably in her male form, quickly getting a glass of water to pour on herself.

She smiled. Much better. Akane deserved a wife who looked like a wife. Her heart beat rapidly just picturing that strong, beautiful Akane Tendo. She sighed.
11422121.title: Akane Tendo

114221211.content:
Ranma walked over to the window, reached out grabbing the top ledge and jumped out swinging himself up onto the roof then padded over to Akane's window and repeated his actions in reverse

"Akane" he shock her a little then called again nothing from her however on the third try she woke and was about to scream but Ranma covered her mouth which lead to

WHAM

"What do you think you are doing you pervert?" she growled forcing herself to keep from yelling

"Waking you my beautiful wife, so she can train before the others are up" that had cause her brain to malfunction and after it rebooted she asked

"What did you say?"

"I said waking you my beautiful wife, so she can train before the others are up"

"Ranma were not married"

"Akane save that for the idiots, but I think we should end this and tell them we have been married for six months now. I'm sick of lying to everyone not to mention stringing the others along." Her mouth moved but no words came out "It's not like I'm saying we let everyone know that I'm also your wife just your husband" he walked over and kissed her before heading to the window and said

"Think about it, please my Love"
114221211.title: Ranma thinks they're married

114221212.content:
Once she dried her head with a towel, Ranma returns to her room. It wouldn't do for a future wife to leave a mess, so she places every thing back in order.

With that done, Ranma left her room in search of her beloved. Her heart thumps hastily as her cerulean eyes lands onto Akane's room plate. The sight of her beloved's name igniting a flurry of warm emotions in her chest. Pressing a hand close, Ranma takes a deep breath.

'Be still my heart.'

Raising her free hand, Ranma knocks onto the wooden frame.

"Akane?" she calls gently, hoping that the barrier between them would not hinder her ears from her 'fiance's' voice. "Are you up?"

When a few moments passed without an answer, Ranma tries again, knocking onto the frame slightly louder. However, no one answered. Worry begins to bubble in the pits of her guts. Where was her loved one? Did something happened? All questions of this nature continued to be conjured up in her mind until someone broke her line of thought with the call of her name.

Quickly, she turns to see....
114221212.title: On the path of a bride to be

choices: Ranma races to the kitchen to prove herself.
Akane enters her room, somewhat confused.
1142212121.content:
Quickly, she turns to see Akane, who stands there drying her hair with a towel.

"Ranma?" Akane blinks, head slightly tilting to the side. "What are you doing here? Is it time for breakfast?"

"I-Ah, um..." Ranma stammers as she takes in the sight of her beloved. Akane's hair glistening from the light above them, makes the tingles in her cheeks grow. Her fingers curl within themselves as she attempts to convey the overflowing love that she has to her 'fiance'. "Akane, I just wanted to...."

Her delay seems to cost her as a frown begins to mar her lover's face. Suspicion and anger becoming apparent within her hazel hues. A sight which bring about much distress, especially with the words that are thrown between them.

"Ranma, did you went into my room just now?" Akane growls, reading her fist as she glares. After all, what is a boy-turned-girl doing in front of her room at this time in the morning. "I swear if you had taken anything, I'll-"

"No!" Ranma balks as she takes a step back. The implications that she would do such a thing like Kuno or, even worst, Happosai. The very thought makes her feel sick. "I would never! I wouldn't do that to you...never to you"

Akane softens her tone at this. "...Ranma?"

"I'll make it up to you. Just wait. I'll prove it to you!"

With that declaration, Ranma rushes downstairs, determined to make it up for the things done in the past. She will prove herself to be the best wife she can. Just for Akane.
1142212121.title: Akane

choices: Akane searches for a few hours and finally found Ranma
Akane searches for a few hours but runs into someone else
11422121212.content:
"Ranma, wait!" Akane shouts, a hand reaching out to stop the running figure. However, it was useless as the red haired girl disappeared from her sight. Heaving a sigh, Akane enters her room mumbling a soft - "What's got into him?" - before deciding that she would talk to Ranma about it later.

She takes her time getting ready, making sure that she even picked out her most comfortable outfit for a relaxing start to the weekend. Akane is determined to buy that cute dress she saw the other week and has even managed to save up just enough to purchase it. All she has to do now is make sure to avoid destroy anything and that dress is as good as hers.

Little does she knows, fate has something different in store for her today. Later, when Akane takes her seat, she is greeted with a smile from a certain redhead.

"Here's your bowl of rice, Akane."

"Thanks..." Akane replies as she warily takes the bowl. Something is definitely up, she is sure of it. Though she doesn't get much to say as someone interrupts.

"Son!" Genma in his panda form in his panda form starts spinning his signboards. "You finally decided to carry out the Anything Goes School of Martial Arts." - the sign flips- "I'm proud of you boy!"

Soun, on the other hand, starts crying openly. "Oh...Akane!"

"Huh." Nabiki lands her gaze onto her sister, amusement reflecting in her eyes. "When's the wedding, sis?"

"It's not like that!" Akane growls, ignoring the heat on her cheek. Now all she has is wait for that jerk to insult her again and there goes her new dress. "We're nothing like that!"

"I-it's not?" Ranma's heart breaking voice, melts through her anger like a hot knife hitting butter. "W-we aren't? But-But I thought..."

"Wha?" Bewildered, Akane turns towards the redhead. "Ranma, I-"

"No." Ranma covers her ears, leaving her seat as tears leak out from her eyes. "P-please, don't."

With that, the redhead leaps away, leaving the rest of the family in shock. Kasumi manages to come out of it first and shoots a disappointed look at the youngest Tendo.

"Ranma-kun did his best in the kitchen early," Kasumi supplies as she shakes her head. "He wanted to make sure that everything was good for you, Akane."

When Genma and Soun started to open their mouth, the oldest Tendo sister silenced them with a frown, allowing Akane to mull over what happened. Something strange is happening again but this time, she has no ideas whatsoever.

Pushing her untouched breakfast away, Akane gets up from the table and announces that she's going out. Hastily, she goes upstairs and grabs her bag, leaving the house as soon as she has it. Something was up and hopefully she can find Ranma soon to find out.
11422121212.title: Akane enters her room, somewhat confused.

114221212122.content:
Unfortunately, sometime soon didn't come as soon as she had hoped.

Akane had searched high and low around the usual spots that Ranma usually goes and some others, but there was no signs of the cursed boy anywhere. She heaves another sigh. Things are undeniably not how her perfect weekend should have been.

Enduring another grumble from her stomach, she adjusts the strap of her bag; her mind sets on looking for Ranma when something lands onto her chest.

"Akane-chan!" Happosai cries out as he gets very comfortable. "Oh! Soft, sweet-"

With a vein throbbing on her temples, she sends the old man flying with a swift punch. "Get off, you per-!" However, her words were cut off as something going into her mouth. Akane hits her chest repeatedly as she tries to stop choking before accidentally swallowing it down.

"Wha-*cough,cough*-Ugh, was that?"

The young Tendo martial artist doesn't like this. This has the beginnings of another one of those troublesome days, especially when Grandfather Happosai is involved. Speaking of the devil, here he is again, hands and legs on the ground as if searching for something.

The small old man hops around the pavement side to side each time repeating frantic, "None! None! None!"

Akane isn't really interested in whatever it was that he is up to. While she may have swallowed something, nothing seems to be happening now. Should she talk to him or continue her search for Ranma?
114221212122.title: Here comes more trouble

1142212121221.content:
She is about to walk away when the old man begins crying, bawling loudly that those around them start staring. His fists slamming onto the ground as he wiggles miserably.

Akane shakes her head as sympathy for the the old man sets into her heart. It must have been something important that he lost and her slamming him into the air is what probably caused it. Cautiously, she makes her way towards Happosai and when she was close enough she manages to here him saying-

"Now I'll never get Ranma to sneak into the girl's changin-" At that, Akane kicks him. Hard. "Aaaaaah!!!"

The angry girl berates herself for pitying him for even one second. What she didn't realised is that she somehow manages to kick the man into an unsuspecting Shampoo, who was handing over a delivery to a customer.

"Shampoo! Watch out!" Akane shouts out, trying to warn the other. Then, she watches as the Chinese girl swiftly passes the box to her customer and catches Happosai, holding as far away from her as possible.

"Aiya. Shampoo no hear news is raining today." The Amazon narrows her eyes. "Shampoo no want you near. No want Disgusting Monster. Violent girl can have you back."

"Mean. You're so mean..." Happosai starts once again with his crocodile tears, though they were gone once he was discarded onto the ground in front of Akane. Angered, Happosai's battle aura grows. "I'll teach you to be respectful to your elders!"

Akane, remembering how Happosai was when he was angry, calls out to Shampoo.

"Shampoo!"
1142212121221.title: Talk to Happosai

11422121212211.content:
Happosai doesn't waste any time in his attack. He crawls all over Shampoo's body as the amazon gives her best enough to rid herself of the leech that clung onto her. It is only a moment later that he stops momentarily on her shoulder with a wicked grin. "I may not know where my red pill is for now but I will find it and teach you to respect your new master!"

Thus, he wastes no time in shoving a white pill inside of Shampoo's mouth. Both of his hands held tight onto Shampoo's lips to prevent her from spitting the pill out.

Watching the Chinese girl struggle, Akane snaps out of her daze and heads over to help the other: Shampoo using her fingers to pry Happosai's arms away and Akane pulling at the back of his purple gi. Struggle as they might, Happosai isn't keen of letting go until his plan is successful.Therefore, he unleashes something that no woman could hope to stand against, especially in close contact.

Mustering his all of his might, he inhales and releases a long stinky fart.

Stunned by this move, the girls released him and quickly cover their noses. Unfortunately for Shampoo, she has no way to escape the full force of the attack and her eyes start to water and her lungs force themselves to repel the disgusting odour out of her body, which results to her swallowing the pill in her mouth.

With a triumphant laugh, Happosai finally lets the girl go and starts to boast.

"With my new and improved recipe of the Student's-Devotion Pills, now you will be- Aaaaaah!" But, as always, fate has something else in stored as Akane once again kicks the old pervert, making sure to send him flying out of state.

"AND STAY AWAY, YOU SLIME!!!" Akane screams before continuing her coughing fit. It takes her a moment for her to recover and form sentences. "Ugh-*cough,cough*- he never *coughs* gives up." When she can finally breathe normally, Akane turns towards Shampoo. "Are you okay, Shampoo?"

The said girl stares blanks at her. "Shampoo okay."

Frowning, Akane stands in front of Shampoo, waving her hand in front of the girl's eyes. The other girl only looks at her as though waiting for... something from her. "Are you sure?"

"Yes master. Shampoo no sick."

Brown eyes widens as Akane quickly takes a step back. Now she knows something is definitely wrong with Shampoo. Since when does she ever get called by name other than insulting ones from Shampoo of all people. Then, she remembers what Happosai had said before she had sent him flying.

"Right..." A facepalm later, she realises that this is surely his work. Only now, she has to clean his mess. "Oh, and I still have to find Ranma. This is just great."

She could find try going to Cat Cafe. Cologne would help her own great daughter. To add to her misery, Akane's stomach lets out a huge growl. Great. Just fantastic. This doesn't help make her decision one bit.

Simmering, she crosses her arms. What should she do now?
11422121212211.title: Akane's new student

114221212122111.content:
In the face of a growing dilemma, Akane sighs. The young Tendo does noticed that she's been doing a lot of these since morning. Though between the two options, Ranma is probably priority one. With that decided, she turns back to face Shampoo who is still rooted on the spot since she has taken the pill. Her once mischievous crimson eyes reflecting dull red ones as she stands eerily still.

Akane grimaces. As much as she wants to leave the foreign girl by herself, Akane feels that it just isn't right. After all, it is partly her fault that Shampoo is like this; staring blankly in front of her as the navy haired girl paces back and forth. After steeling herself, she stops her pacing to address the problem at hand.

"Shampoo?" Akane calls tentatively, watching as the Chinese girl faces her. "Can you go back to Neko Hanten and let your great grandmother know what happened?"

Slowly, the girl nods. "Shampoo go Neko Hanten. Tell Great Grandmother." Akane lets out sighs in relief. Now that would solve one of these problems. She continues on her way when hears a short inquiry. "Go together?"

"Huh?" Akane blinks. She hasn't expected this. Perhaps she has to clarify what she means before Shampoo would leave. "No, I mean you go and I'll search for Ranma."

But all she got in answer was a shake of the head.

"Then Shampoo no go. Master no safe alone." The Amazon twitches and heads back to Akane, keeping the pace once she's within range. "No leave Master. Hurt if do."

Resisting the urge to send the other girl flying, Akane clenches her fists. Her next words comes out spiteful.

"I can take care of myself. I don't need you to baby me. I get enough of that from that jerk already."

"Master no baby. Too big."

A vein pops out of Akane's head. "Ah, is that so?"

At this point, she is half tempted to leave Shampoo to fend for herself. This was all that old pervert's fault. If he ever shows his face in front of her for the next ten hours-- A loud rumble cuts her train of thoughts.

Akane groans."Ugh, if only I knew what's going on. Ranma's been acting strange this whole morning. Staying as a girl, not changing back and... he looks so heartbroken." Halting her steps and nearly gets bumped by Shampoo, she beams as she has an epiphany. "Wait, that's it! I know where to find Ranma." In her excitement, she grabs Shampoo's hand and pulls her along. "Let's go Shampoo!"

~~~~~

The journey to the nearest burger joint hadn't take too long as the two girls stood in line, waiting for their turn. It has been rather awkward for Akane though, as Shampoo flat out refuses to leave her side and would silently stand behind her....always referring her as master.

It is disturbing to say the least. Therefore, she tries to break the ice.

"So Shampoo, have you eaten?"

The girl replies in the negative. "No breakfast. No want hear Mousse squawking."

"You too?" Akane stare at her in incredulity. "I mean I skipped breakfast too. Like I said, Ranma was acting weird and lots of stuff happened so here we are."

Akane continues to rant about a lot of other things as the other listens. She talks about stuff at school and a little about how insensitive Ranma can be. And although the other girl doesn't say much the whole time, Akane is really happy that, for once, someone was listening to her point of view. By the time the two reached the cashier, Akane is smiling brightly at the Chinese girl.

"Hey, you mentioned that you haven't eaten right? Well, go ahead and pick whatever you like. My treat." With that said, she lists off her orders to the cashier and then turns back to the other girl. "So, have you decided?"

Strangely, Shampoo looks away. "Shampoo not know this food. Always eat own food. No try Japan food."

"Well, now's your chance!" Akane's cheer doesn't fade as she continues to insist. "And if you don't like it, we could order something else next time. Besides-" She goes a little further by adding. "-don't knock it off until you tried it."

To her success, Shampoo finally relents and points towards a few burgers on the sign. Nodding at her choices, Akane keeps her words and tells the cashier to add them to her bill. It takes almost half an hour before they could finally leave and Akane hands Shampoo one of the burgers she had chosen.

"Here, try it and tell me what you think later, okay?"

After passing it over, Akane turns determinedly towards her target destination, missing the blush from the Chinese girl as she continues her stride down the streets of Nerima.

This time, she'll find him and settle this once and for all.
114221212122111.title: Find Ranma first....or not

1142212121221111.content:
A few minutes later, the two girls reach the park. Akane's hazel eyes looks around the area and halt once she sees the redhead sitting on the bricks under tree. The same place where she had gone when the bluenette had shared about her previous crush to Ranma.

He stills remember...

Akane turns to Shampoo who has still yet to eat her burger, holding onto it while looking downwards. She's a little curious about this behaviour but tells herself that she'll ask about it as soon as she's done talking with Ranma. Besides, she'll have to inform him that she'll be going over to Neko Hanten after this and might be home late.

"Shampoo?" Akane calls, snapping the other girl's dull eyes to hers and passes the rest of the burgers Shampoo ordered to her. "I'm going to have a little chat with Ranma, so you'll have to wait here."

"Master leaving Shampoo?" The said girl tears her eyes away, her gaze downcast even as she takes them from Akane. "Not want Shampoo?"

Blinking, Akane shakes her head. Shampoo probably thought she was leaving her to fend for herself. "Nah, I'm just going to talk with him. We can go to Neko Hanten once I'm done. So stay here until I call you, okay?"

Hesitantly, Shampoo nods. "Shampoo wait here."

Akane flashes the other girl a smile as she heads over to the one who is sulking under the tree, once again missing how Shampoo pulls the food close to her chest, face lit in a soft red. The navy haired girl is in a pretty good mood now but she schools her features into a much serious one when she nears Ranma.

Without saying anything, she places the bag of burgers down between them before sitting down. Then she opens the bag, grabbing a burger and chopping down once she removes part of the wrapper. Akane takes a few more bite before addressing to the redhead who still haven't lifts her head.

"Take one. It's better when it's hot." At the shake of Ranma's head, Akane tries again. "Really? It's one of your favourites." When there isn't a reply, Akane sighs. It must be serious then, since he's not bickering with her as usual. Better get it out and over with. "Alright, Ranma. What happened this morning?"

When the redhead still refuses to answer, Akane's temper starts to spike. "Ranma! You better answer me. Stop ignoring me already. I spent the whole morning searching for you without having breakfast. The least you can do is answer me!"

Akane was about to go on when a chocked sob reached her ears. Anger melting away, she puts her hands on her lap, food forgotten. "I...Ranma, I'm sorry. Something must have happened to you that you would-"

But her words were cut off as the redhead frantically shakes her head. "N-no, it isn't your fault, Akane. Don't blame yourself. I know I'm not a good enough wife for you yet. But!-" At this, Ranma grabs her hands, lifting both them and the burger that she was eating. "I promise I'll do my best! Kasumi-san said that she'll help me. P-please don't break our engagement..."

To say that she was flabbergasted by Ranma's words would be a huge understatement.

Brown eyes widens so much to the point that the pupils start looking like tiny dots. It is as those her brain has short circuited from the amount of chaos that seems to be centred around her this time rather than Ranma.

Watching as the ever passionate martial artist become listless, Ranma panics. "Akane?!"

But, Ranma doesn't get much of a chance to do anything else but leaping away from Akane when a chuí lands on the spot which she was still standing. Not long later, her attacker shows her face, grabbing the thrown weapon into her hands and readies her stance.

"Shampoo?" -is the astonish cry of Ranma as she readies her own defensive stance. "Please calm down."

"Who you?" The Chinese girl frowns as she stays on ground. "What do to Master?"

"I don't understand... Shampoo, I'm Ranma." Though, her astonishment doesn't take long to give way to another feeling. "And your weapon almost hit Akane!"

"You not Airen. Have Girl-Type face. No act same." Then, the Amazon use the momentary distraction to launch one of her chuí(s) forward. "Now die!"

Ranma lets out an unladylike tsk as she dodges attacks coming from almost of all directions. The redhead had hoped that she could avoid from fighting but as her eyes lands onto Akane. She wouldn't leave her beloved, especially with a Shampoo who seems to be acting strange.

Taking a deep breath, Ranma adjust her stance. She would protect her 'husband'. Just as she would when she was in trouble. If there's no other choice, Ranma will not back down.
1142212121221111.title: Finally on track... (Shampoo vs Ranma)

choices: They are faced with another obstacle
11422121212211112.content:
When Shampoo was told to wait, she listened. After all, her master had commanded it and reassured her that she would return soon. The Amazon was still slightly worried but since it was her Airen that she is meeting, she was sure that no true harm would occurred. It is then that she finally removes the wrapper from the food which her Master had introduced.

The food, strange as it is, is not really that good. Too much mayonnaise and the bun is much drier than she would like. A meat bun would be a better meal. However, it doesn't stop her from continuing her meal, trying to savour it. It is a gift after all, one that she hasn't done anything of worth to receive, but still a gift.

So, the foreign girl munches her food quietly and was about to finish her last bite when she hears her Master's shouts. Turning her gaze upwards, she narrows her eyes at the scene. Though when no fighting occurs, she watches them warily as she finishes her first burger.

Somehow, within the time of throwing her wrapper away into a nearby bin, the redhead had gotten up and held the small hands that gave her such warmth in a brief amount of time. Her fury only grows when she heard the girl begging her Master not to break the engagement.

Ranma never begs. He is too prideful to say or do such a thing which it can only mean one thing. That person with her Master is an impostor and her Master is in danger.

Immediately, Shampoo pulls out her chuí(s) and hurls one forward, making sure that the weapon's path would go nowhere near the bluenette.

Now, faced with the fake, Shampoo is about to charge forward once again to clash with her opponent when her Master suddenly runs in between them shouting- "STOP!"

With great effort, Shampoo tries stopping her charge but the pull was too great so she lands straight onto her Master. So focused on making sure that her chuí(s) do not land on her Master, she doesn't realised how soft her landing is until a polite cough from above snaps her back to reality.

In an instant, the Chinese girl quickly gets off and turns away to fight the heat that is rushing into her cheeks. What is wrong with her? Ever since her Master had first hold her hand, she has started to feel funny. It's as though...

"Shampoo?" Her Master's voice cuts through as she feels herself automatically turning to face her. "Are you okay?"

"Is fine," Though she frowns when she remembers what happened earlier. "Should not have run in fight. Master lucky Shampoo no hurt."

Master looks away. "I know. But it was the one thing that I could think of in the heat of the battle..."

Shampoo has nothing else of worth to add to that so she scans her suroundings noting a missing person. Turning to her Master, she asks. "Where Fake Girl Type?"

There is a slight furrow in brows before she continues with her words. "Oh, Ranma? I told him to go back home and that I'm going to Neko Hanten with you."

She nods. She remembers Master talking about it before. "Master want see Great Grandmother."

Shampoo watches as the other blinks, then tilt her head to the side cutely. "Hey Shampoo, don't take this the wrong way...But why are you calling me Master?" -Then the navy haired girl covering her face with her hands, groaning- "Nevermind, just don't call me that."

The Chinese girls shakes her head. "No call Master Master is disrespect. Shampoo good student. Shampoo respect."

A sighs escapes the bluenette's lips. "Fine. Let's just go."

With her Master leading the way, Shampoo starts feeling downcast.

Why is Master not smiling? She was so much happier earlier and now she is not. It was definitely that impostor's fault. Ever since she showed up, Master's mood hasn't been good.

She decides that she would have to be extra careful around that fake next time she sees her.
11422121212211112.title: From the eyes of a student

choices: Lunch went on without a hinge
114221212122111121.content:
During the entire walk, Shampoo remains silent as they make their way back to her Great-grandmother's restaurant. She wouldn't mind the silence between them much if it has been before she knew of how uplifting it was when her Master spoke to her with much cheer.
It disturbs her for some reason.

Shampoo wants these feelings to end so she halts her stride, trying to say something. Though no matter how much she wills herself to do it, nothing came out of her mouth. Then, not wanting to be left behind, she looks up only to see her Master's face an inch from her own.

"Shampoo?" The corcern in her Master's voice stirs something inside of her. "Are you sure you're okay?"

Shampoo simply nods in answer. She doesn't want to burden or upset her Master anymore than she already has. The Chinese girl stares as the navy haired girl hums in acknowledgement and turns back around. However, just as she was about to continue walking, her Master suddenly bends down with her hands on her back.

"Here. I'll carry you back."

"M-master?" Shampoo sputters. "Why carry Shampoo?"

"Oh, don't give me that." This time, the bluenette turns her head as much as she could to face her. "I've noticed you've been leaning slightly more onto your left this whole time. My guess is that you got it when you fall on top of me earlier."

"Shampoo okay. Leg not hurt. Can walk fine." Shampoo tried to reason. But, Akane was having none or it.

"Don't be so sturborn. You're only injured because you stopped yourself from hurting me. Let me just repay the favour."

It takes a short while for Shampoo to reluctantly accept help. The Amazon would normally ignored such acts unless they were order from one of the elders or Ranma, and since this is her Master...

"Will let Master carry." After giving her affirmation, she slowly puts her legs through her Master's arms and held back a gasp when she feels them wrapped around her thighs.

At that moment, the world feels like it has been sped up. Her head slightly dizzy as the pulse of her heart blocked out the sounds from her surrounding. She doesn't even realised that her Master has started moving until the other spoke once more.

"How is it back there?"

Shampoo takes a deep breath before replying. "Shampoo fine Master."

"You know, you don't have to keep calling me that." After a slight pause, her voice sounded much rougher, with more spirit. "Or any of those other names. Like Violent Girl or Perv- Look, I have a name. Just call me that okay?"

Nodding against her back, Shampoo answers. "Shampoo call Master Mistress now."

"Oh, nevermind." Akane just resigns at this point. "Just leave it as it is."

~~~
It takes a couple more minutes to reach Neko Hanten. Dimly, the Chinese girl notes the amount of customers inside and decides that it would be better from them to enter through the back door. When her Master agrees to her reasoning, she leads them to the back and asks to be let down.

Once her feet are on the ground, Shampoo opens the unlock door.

Akane raises a brow. "You leave your door unlocked? What if there was a theif or someone dangerous around?"

"Shampoo no worry. Can handle any intruder. Beat them up and throw outside. Never came back."
A sweat drop falls at her back of her head. "I see."

Shampoo is about turn when her Great-grandmother's voice came from beside her. "Welcome back, great-granddaughter. I don't believe that you had said that you would be bringing... guests when you went out almost an hour ago."

"Good afternoon, Oba-san." The bluenette greets, poking her head inside the open door frame. "Sorry for intruding but something came up."

"I'm sure you do and I will hear what you have to say. But first, Shampoo-" The elder woman turns to her great-granddaughter, staring in her eyes before turning back to Akane. "The thing you mentioned, it has something to do with Shampoo doesn't it?"

Akane nods her head. "That's correct."

"This is quite troublesome indeed," Cologne muses. "Will she still be able to serve the customers?"

"I think so... She was still able to fight Ranma earlier." With that said, Akane turns to Shampoo. "Shampoo, are you still able to work?"

"Shampoo fine," she affirms. "Leg much better. Can serve customer but Master no leave Shampoo's sight. No safe."

Cologne narrows her eyes at Akane. "I think we have much to talk about later."

"It's not-!"

Shampoo interrupts with a shake of her head. "No Master fault. Master try stop Panty Thief. Shampoo careless."

The elder Amazon woman frown, glancing towards the kitchen then back to the both of them. "We'll continue this conversation later. I doubt Mousse would last long at this hour without help." Then, she turns to Akane. "It looks like you would have to help out too. After all, Shampoo would not go anywhere without you so the both of you will serve the customers."

Akane sighs for the hundred time. "Okay."

"There is a spare uniform upstairs. You can change there. Shampoo, I need you in the front now."

"Great-grandmother-"

"I will not hear it, child. The Tendo girl will be fine by herself upstairs." After saying this, the elder woman hops away on her stick.

"Great-grandmother no understand! Last time leave Master-"

"Shampoo," Akane calls, immediately getting the attention of said girl. "I'll be fine. It's just upstairs and if anyone comes, I'll just kick them back outside. Even if it's Ranma." Shampoo is about to retort when her Master directs one of her dazzling smile. "Okay?"

Determinedly, she looks up, searching those hazel hues for any sign of deceit. However, when she finds none and couldn't stand having puppy-like eyes gazing at her, she hesitantly nods. "Shampoo wait in front. Shout if need help."

"I won't." Akane affirms as she heads up the stairs. Though just before Shampoo enters the kitchen, she hears her Master voice saying a soft- "Thank you, Shampoo." - with a rush of wind accompanying it.

And as she crosses pass the kitchen and to the front, Shampoo felt herself being covered with warm blankets and fluffy clouds. With a smile of her own, she greets and shares part of how she feels with those who chose to dine here this afternoon.
114221212122111121.title: Next stop: Cat Cafe

choices: Akane insists that Shampoo comes too
1142212121221111211.content:
A couple minutes passes and soon enough, she has the orders from several table. Although as soon as Shampoo relays the orders to the back, a shout of her name came from behind her. Instinctively, she jumps out of the way and when she looks back, Stupid Mousse is hugging one of the customers happily.

"Shampoo! Where have you been? I missed you so much."

Put off by this display, she scoffs. "No disturb paying customer meal or Duck Boy sleep in cage tonight."

The blind boy pales as he quickly lets go, apologising to the person he hugged before called by great-grandmother for a delivery.

Shampoo rolls her eyes as she continues her daily routine. She is glad that the blind boy would be out for awhile. Normally, she would volunteer for this job since it means she could keep away from annoying clingy duck. Though this time, she has her Master to worry about.

There is no way she would leave her side willingly. With her out of sight, Shampoo starts becoming agitated. Crimson orbs would scan the dining area every few seconds, causing some of the customers to repeat themselves.

She is also well aware that her blunder didn't go unnoticed as she could feel the familiar twin eyes of the elder Amazon burning behind her back. However, in that moment, Shampoo's worry outweighs any punishment that her great-grandmother would dish out later.

Fortunately, she doesn't have to wonder for long as her Master appears into sight, dressed appealingly in one of the store's spare cheongsams: a pretty light pink one accompanied by roses of the same hue and light blue leaves.

"I'm here," Akane announces as she stand by the partition between the kitchen and the dining area. "Where do I start first?"

Cologne simply throws two plates of gyoza towards her. "Table 3 and 6."

Brown eyes widens as the navy haired girl struggles to catch both plate. She almost drops one to the floor but it is caught by Shampoo who passes it back to her Master, smiling in thanks.

"Shampoo!"

The shout of her great-grandmother startles her. A furious glare greets her sight when the two pairs of eyes meet.

"But great-grandmother, Mast-"

"No buts! If you really need to call her that, the Tendo girl must earn the right to do so."

Shampoo frowns, great-grandmother is really pushing her buttons. Why can't the elder understand how she feels? It is her right-no, her duty to serve her Master. If this goes on, the young Amazon will put aside their relationship and leave here once and for-

"She's right, Shampoo." Shampoo looks at her Master in disbelief as the girl's face sours. "Although Oji-san is the one who did this to you, I should have put in more effort in helping you get out of your situation."

Shampoo vehemently denies this with the shake of her head. "That no true. Master here find cure. No need help Shampoo at Neko Hanten but still do. Master no leave Shampoo or treat Shampoo badly. Even buy food for Shampoo."

Akane's look softens. "Shampoo..."

They stare at each other for a moment until suddenly cheers erupts around them, frightening both girls.

"Wooooah!"

"This is a dream come true!"

"Kiss already!"

"Great show girls!"

And as the applause grows, so does the heat on their faces.

"P-perverts," Akane grumbles as she looks away. "We'll talk later Shampoo."

The Chinese girl manages a quick nod before her Master hastily scurries away.

~~~

A few hours later, Akane flops tiredly onto a chair, exhausted both pysically and emotionally. She groans as she remembers how her day went as the customers were keen on teasing her about Shampoo. The fact that Shampoo does nothing to deny this, while continuously refering as her as Master, does nothing but fuel to her embarrassment.

What's worst is that she has no way to vent her frustrations of the whole ordeal, thus making her quite irritated and tired from all of the pent up emotions. Deciding that this is a good moment to vent, Akane opens her mouth to shout when a blur of white grabs hold of her and squeeze her shoulders tight.

"Shampoo! I heard nasty rumours that you now belong to the second-rate Tendo Akane. Tell me it's a lie!"
Several veins pops outs visually as she slaps him. Hard.

"Oh," Akane growls. "Second-rate, am I?"

And just as quickly, Mousse jumps up to face her, multiple of knives poking out of his robe. "Tendo Akane! I won't allow anyone else to have Shampoo! Not even it's a girl!"

The young Tendo martial artist prepares her stance and shouts back. "Shampoo isn't mine! She doesn't being to anyone but herself! And being a girl has nothing to do with this!"

'I should know,' Akane internally grumbles. 'Ranma's always been roping me into these kinds of messes, after all. Today more than others.'

"For Shampoo, I won't hold back! Even it's a girl," Mousse yells, only to be him to be douche in water. His angry squawks are ignored as Shampoo grabs him by the neck and tosses him into a cage.

"Hmph," Shampoo jeers at him. "Stupid Mousse sit in cage now. No wait tonight." The Chinese girl ignores the pleading squawks as she turns to her Master. "Master want duck roast or braise? Shampoo know how cook both."

Akane sweat drops. "No, thanks. I'm not that hungry."

The navy haired girl watches as Shampoo snaps her fingers in disappointment before dropping the cage to the floor and kicks it away. She pities Mousse but this time, he sort of deserves it.

Though, before she could comment on this, Cologne jumps towards them with her stick. "Come, both of you. We'll discuss Shampoo's situation in the basement."

"What about the store?" Akane asks, gesturing the dining room.

Cologne ponders about it for a moment, then she turns back to them. "Shampoo, watch the restaurant while we're away. I'm sure you'll be able to manage the place for awhile."

Shampoo angrily shouts. "Great-grandmother!"

"Do not take that tone with me, Shampoo. You are a Joketsuzoku and I am still the leader and your great-grandmother. You'll do well to remember that."

Akane, sensing the tension between the two, stops and ponder on what she should do...
1142212121221111211.title: Rush Hours and Confrontations

11422121212211112111.content:
As the two Amazons square off, Akane steps in between them, holding out her hands and turns to the elder woman saying, "Oba-san, can I talk to Shampoo for awhile?"

When the other woman doesn't budge from her spot, she adds. "Alone?"

At this, the elder woman huffs and hops away, keeping some distance between them. Once Cologne is far enough, Shampoo doesn't waste anytime.

"Master no go alone. Many traps in basement. Master not know where avoid secret switch."

Taking a deep breath, Akane steadies her emotion before looking up to Shampoo, gesturing towards a nearby table and pulls out a chair to seat. She waits until the other girl has taken her girl before touching the heart of the matter.

"Look Shampoo," Akane begins firmly. "I don't know what you had that makes you think that you need to guard me every minute but I am a martial artist. I can protect myself."

"Mas-"

"Let me finish." She interrupts, a frown visible on her face. " Honestly, this whole thing that's going on is weird and I don't just mean you. I'm talking about Ranma too. Besides, your great-grandmother wouldn't ask you to stay without any reasons. This involves you too."

Akane pauses a moment to catch her breath, then continues. "The point is, I'm going to help you. So, just trust me, okay?"

Shampoo doesn't answer her immediately, sitting in silence as the bang of her hair overshadows her face. Though, Akane knows better than to say anything now. She is asking a lot from Shampoo. Trust is not something that Akane takes lightly and she suspects that Shampoo is the same in this regard.

Akane waits patiently as the other girls maintains her silence. Shampoo probably has a lot to mull over, at least that's what the youngest Tendo imagine. Those dull eyes of hers makes it rather difficult for her to decipher the other's thoughts.

This is made even prominent when Shampoo suddenly gets up from her chair and closes the distance between them.

'Is she going to object and challenge me?' Akane ponders as she regards her with determination in her eyes. 'If she does, I will accept any challenges. I'm still the heir of the 'Tendo Anything Goes Martial Art School' after all.'

Remaining in her seat, Akane doesn't hesitates as Shampoo's face is an inch from hers. Nevertheless, her harden gaze melts as the ever compassionate girl's eyes notes the subdued nature of the Amazon's crimson eyes.

It wasn't right. No one should be subjected to this kind of treatment. Not even Shampoo.

"I'll get you back to normal, Shampoo," The young martial artist declares, straightening her shoulders. "I promise."

Then, to her greatest astonishment, Shampoo kiss her on the lip. A soft and tender touch that freezes her entire world as she is struck speechless for the second time today.

Shivers run up her spine as Shampoo whispers- "Wo ai ni." - before backing up with an unmistakable smile on her face. Somehow, those eyes that were previously dull felt full of life now. It stuns her with how much love there is lit within them. "Shampoo wait here. Come home soon Master."

The beats of her heart doesn't fade as Shampoo slips away, heading towards the counter.

Emotions after emotions, all indescribable, piles up and steams through the skin of her ears.
Akane, being the bearer of all these emotions, does the one thing that she often does in these situations: with a lot of anger and denial.

Her fist clamped onto the wooden material of the table, raising it up dangerously high to slam the living sense into the foreign girl. Though before she manages to do just that, her visions darkens and the last thing she feels is her navy hair whipping onto her face harshly.
11422121212211112111.title: Staggering Transitions between Obedience and Love

114221212122111121111.content:
When she comes to, Akane notes her head is nested on her arms. Bleary eyes, her nose picks up the distinct smell of tea. Blinking slowly to rid the cobwebs, a voice addresses her.

"You woke up quicker than I expected."

Shaking her head, Akane watches as Cologne takes a sip from her cup.

She frowns. "Where am I?"

"The basement" - is the elder's cryptic reply.

"Did you have to knock me out?" Akane mumbles and tries to stand up, only to regret it as her head spins again. "Ugh, my head..."

"You would have destroyed my restaurant if I hadn't." Cologne place her cup down and regards the younger girl. "Now, I believe we have conversation to be continued. What happened to my great-granddaughter and son-in-law?"

"Son-in-law?" she repeats, blinking in suprise. "How did you know about Ranma too?"

An old brow rises. "I may be aged but I'm certainly not deaf."

"What?!" Akane shouts, taken aback. "Then,why didn't you stop her from ki-"

Instantly, Akane's face is dyed crimson.

"You mean before Shampoo has defiled an ancient Amazon law by using the Kiss of Marriage to an outsider female?" Akane's frantic nods causes the elder woman to chuckle. "Weren't you the one who said that you wanted to talk to her alone?"

"Wha-! But, that's- You saw!" she sputters while her arms flail helplessly before covering her face, groaning loudly. "I didn't know that was going to happen!"

"Perhaps." Cologne takes another sip. "But now, that's not what's important." The elder woman continues before Akane has a chance to interrupt again. "As one of the longest elder of the Amazon tribe, I specialise in many types of herbs and magical items. None of which that shows these kinds of effects."

The elder Amazon takes a moment to ponder, then regards Akane. "Did Happy said anything about what she gave them?"

"Them?" Akane blinks, then shakes her head. "As far as I know, he only gave it to Shampoo. Something about a new recipe of the Student's Devotion Pill."

"Hmmm... That pill is supposed to make the master and student inseparable. Physically, not mentally." The woman then eyes Akane. "It is also done with oral intake."

Akane sighs. "He attacked me so I kicked him. I do remember accidentally swallowing something after that but he was heading straight to Shampoo so I forgotten about it."

Nodding, Colgne explains. "I need to know what Happy did to the pills before I can make something to counteract it."

"Then we are stuck until he shows his face again?" Akane growls.

Sensing a story, Cologne eyes her. "Hmm?"

"I kicked him hard this morning," Akane sweat drops and finding the timber marks of the table interesting. "He may not be back until school starts on Monday."

Sighing, Cologne gets onto her stick and hops of the chair. "I suppose we'll talk more later."

"What about Ranma?"

"Do you know what is going on with him?" At the shake of Akane's head, Cologne shakes her head. "Then, you'll have to find out. Meanwhile, Shampoo will be following you back. Temporarily until a solution comes up."

"She's coming back with me?" Akane pales. "Can't she stay here?"

Cologne gives her a looks that convey- 'Do you think she would?' - and that is enough to warrant another sigh.
Akane relents. "Fine."

After Akane's reply, Cologne gestures her to follow, signalling the end of the conversation. And as the navy haired girl heads up the stairs, she truly wonders if she is prepared for another one of these episodes.
114221212122111121111.title: Cologne's Confrontation

1142212121221111211111.content:
After a brief reminder from the elder Amazon, about a possible way on how to cure Shampoo, Akane follows behind Cologne as the woman hops and leads them to a door. Glaring light momentarily blinds her, she halts in her movements, letting her eyes to adjust. Then, when she has gathered her bearings, Akane looks around. Strangely, Shampoo is no where to been seen.

Has she left?

Thus, she immediately calls for the Chinese girl and only when the girl answers her call that her hearts stops thumping. Akane notes the old crone's eyes on her again and huffs, trying to retort when a pair of arms suddenly wraps around her.

"Master back." Akane could feel her face flushing rapidly as things abruptly seems intimidate. "Is very worry when no come back so long. Shampoo glad Master safe."

Words fail her as Akane once again has to work through the torrent of emotions within herself. It is then with great effort that she manages to stumble out, "S-Shampoo. Please let go of me. Now."

As the foreign girl releases her hold, the navy haired girl takes another breath and starts again. "L-listen." Not that it is doing her any better. "I'm going to make a call. Could you just wait here? Just a few more minutes. I really need to talk to someone."

It doesn't take Shampoo long to answer.

"Shampoo trust Master." Shampoo looks away, her hair covering her features . "Is lonely but Shampoo know Master no leave without tell Shampoo."

"Shampoo..." This time, Akane's hand reaches out, willing the other to look as she explains herself. "I did promise to help you. I will try. No matter how awkward it is." Another sigh. It doesn't automatically means that it would be any easier for her. "Just five minutes more, okay?"

Akane only releases her hand when she's gotten the okay. Briefly, she asks the elder if she could use the phone and a point of her wooden stick shows her the direction.

Once she is faced to the phone, she dials the number which she has memorized by heart, her insides churning as the levers of the circle returns to its origin point. Each one grating on her nerves until she is done.

A minute pass and when someone finally picks up, Akane hears....
1142212121221111211111.title: The Beginning of a Floundering Journey

11422121212211112111111.content:
"Tendo residence."

The familiar drawl makes Akane want to sigh even more. However, beggars can't be choosers. There is just too much at stake, even if it means that she would have to start saving up her allowances again for the next shopping trip.

"Nabiki onee-chan, it's me." Akane said. "I'm coming home now and we're going to have another guest over."

"Another stray, huh?" Rather than being angry like Akane thought she would be, Nabiki's question held a curious tone. "Who is it this time? Gee Akane, if I didn't know any better, I might think that maybe Ranma's not doing much in trying to be a good wife~"

"Nabiki!" Akane shouted. "It's not funny!"

She should have known that Nabiki of all people would find out about this.

"You're right." A pause. "It's not funny, it's hilarious."

Akane could feel her anger rising as she struggles not to crush the phone in her hands. Already there were small lines forming near her fist. Though before it gets worse, she takes a few deep breaths and tries to calm down.

"Something's wrong Nabiki!" Akane stresses, trying not to be too loud. "I don't what's wrong with Ranma but Oji-san did something to Shampoo. Now she feels that she has to protect me like I can't defend myself. So many things happened and I'm just so angry!"

Memories from earlier this day start emerging into her mind. From the very first moment when she kicked the old leech until in Neko Hanten where she was kissed and confessed by the place's own waitress. The declaration of love. The tenderness in her eyes and the softness of such a brief touch upon her lips.

It was wrong.

Shampoo didn't know what she was doing. Cologne claims that the young Amazon had a higher resistance to these sort of...'things'. But, the kiss just threw that out assumption of the window. Does Shampoo really feel that way?

Of course not.

Anger forgotten, the youngest Tendo sister tries to hold back her tears. "I really want to help them Nabiki. Even Shampoo. But I just don't know how. Cologne doesn't know for sure and Oji-san is nowhere near here now. I just don't know what to do." Then, she wipes away the wetness on her cheeks, doing her best to sound normal. "Nabiki onee-chan, please... I need help."

There was a long silence from the other side once she has finished. Only the lack of the end call tone reassures Akane that her sister hasn't hand up the phone. Her sniffles didn't help her as she continues to wait for something.

Seconds felt like hours and Akane was about to hang up when Nabiki's voice stops her.

"Did something happened between you and Shampoo?" This time, her older sister's voice sounded much serious. Something more considerate. "Do you want to talk about it? I can head over there in a few minutes."

Touched, and slightly surprised by Nabiki's insight, Akane smiles. "I'm f-...I'm not hurt, onee-chan. But I do want to talk to someone about this. You don't need to come. Shampoo and I are coming in a bit."

If Nabiki heard her little stumble in her answer, she doesn't mentioned it. "Right. Just come to my room later, we'll talk there."

Akane nods, then remembering that she was on the phone, she replies, "Okay... Oh, and tell Kasumi onee-san to add one more set for dinner tonight. Shampoo's staying over."

After hearing Nabiki's confirmation, they said their good byes and Akane finally ends the call. Turning around, she enter the bathroom to freshen herself before heading back out.
11422121212211112111111.title: A Debatable Help

114221212122111121111111.content:
Another couple of minutes were spent washing the dampness of her cheek and peering into the mirror to make sure that the redness doesn't linger in her eyes. Lightly slapping her face and a few deep breaths later, Akane felt more or less ready to face reality again.

After all, the Tendo heir refuses to give up that easily.

It is only after she leaves the washroom that she noticed that it has been way or the time that she had told Shampoo to wait. The cat-shaped clock pointing towards the beginnings of evening light.

Concerned, Akane quickly makes her way downstairs in search of the Chinese girl. To her relief, she found Shampoo in her dazed state expertly chopping a whole basin of vegetables in equal and bite-sized portions. It doesn't take the waitress more than a few seconds to finish slicing several stalks of spring onions before moving on to the next batch.

Fighting off the jealous tinge, Akane decides to wait at one of the tables until Shampoo is done before heading home. It was the least she could do, especially since the girl has trusted her enough in that protective state to let her calm down.

In her boredom of waiting, Akane's thoughts starts to wander towards a certain lavender haired foreigner.

Admittedly, Akane doesn't have the best of impressions of Shampoo since the two were always butting heads one way or the other. Despite helping one another occasionally, she hasn't sit down to consider what it would have been like if the two got along with each other. It certainly makes her wonder if the two could somehow get along, even when this whole 'thing' is over.

There is also another thing that bothers her too.

She could try Cologne's suggestion and observe what happens. Although, Akane wasn't sure if Shampoo would be willing to harm her 'Master'. And what about the thing that old pervert did to the pills?

Hands in her cheeks, she continues to grind until a voice shocks her from her reprieve.

"Shampoo done. Ready go now."

Stilling her heart, Akane gives a short reply. "Okay, let's go."

A gleam catches her eyes as she stands. In Shampoo's hands were the familiar metal box with foreign strokes. Curious, Akane questions this.

"Do you need to do a delivery first? I'll go with you. I can use the exercise."

Shampoo shakes her head. "No delivery. Great grand mother give bao since Shampoo sleep at Tendo house."

"You don't have to," Akane says with a shake of her head. "I would have let you stay either way. It was partly my fault that all this happened to you."

"But-"

Before leaving herself to feel down again, Akane leaps out of her seat, not hearing the start of Shampoo's sentence.

"Let's go, Shampoo." The navy haired girl motions her to follow before starting her walk back home. "It's really getting late and Dad is going to be worried if I don't even make it back for dinner."

With that said, Akane continues her walk. Her mind wandering as they passes familiar routes she has taken since she was a child. Once again, it goes back towards the one who was following her. In truth, when she thinks about it, Akane doesn't know the foreign girl except for the fact that she was always interested in Ranma.

Seeing her like this however, she tries to imagine what Shampoo is like without Ranma only to come up blank.

"Hey Shampoo." Akane partially looks over to girl as she walks. "Can you tell me about yourself? I want to know more about you. Or maybe any stories that you like to share? I remember you listening to my long rant earlier at the burger place. I could return the favour and listen this time."

"Shampoo no mind listen." Akane nods as she turns to focus to the road in front of them. "Story interesting. Shampoo happy Ma-... Akane told Shampoo."

"Really? Something usually cut me off from finishing but I'm here if you need someone to talk to..." Then, with widen brown eyes, Akane whirls around. "Shampoo? Did you just call me by my name?"

The young Tendo's delight grows as Shampoo confirms her previous words. Maybe what Cologne had said was true. Maybe Shampoo's not too far gone after all.

"That's great, Shampoo!" Eager hands reach out and cup the other's ones, dangling in the space between them. "You're starting to resist the pill. I'm so glad for you."

And as she revels in this new discovery, Shampoo smiles. "Shampoo tell story now?"

Happily giving her affirmation, Akane pulls the Chinese girl along; their feet bringing them home as the other retells a tale from her past.
114221212122111121111111.title: On the way back home

1142212121221111211111112.content:
As they were walking home, Akane's moods is much better than before.Shampoo's starting to show signs of improvement and maybe she'll finally have a proper meal today. However, as she thinks that, the Tendo heir senses an attack coming from behind and quickly grabs Shampoo close, just in the nick of time to avoid a lash.

At the sound of an annoying familiar laugh, Akane stays on her guard and glares at the figure on a nearby wall.

"How dare you land your hands on her!" Kodachi demands as her ribbon twirls beside her, black petal accompanies her as the gymnast leaps down with a glare. "Release her, you harlot!"

A nerve pops out of Akane's temple. "What do you want, Kodachi? 'Your beloved' Ranma's not here and I'm not in the mood to fight with you right now."

Kodachi simply tilt her head to the side, her expression now curious.

"Akane-sama, do you not recognise me?" A shiver runs down Akane's spine as the Kuno stares at her longingly. "It is I, Kuno Kodachi, The Black Rose and your beloved wife. I have search for you near and far only to finally be reunited..." Then, she turns to glare at Shampoo. "Only to find you trapped and forced to be within this harlot's grasp!"

Before Akane could form a retort to such a ridiculous sentence, the Amazon beside her draws her Chúi and stands in front of her, voice filled with shocking venom.

"Shampoo no tell Master what to do! Crazy Girl leave or Shampoo kill!"

Kodachi, unlike Akane, simply sneers. "Such crudeness. I suppose that it is to be expected from one with such boorish background." Kodachi pauses for a moment to fling a bouquet which Shampoo immediately bats away. "You are but a weed in a garden of roses, marring the flowers' beauty by being in the presence of my beloved."

At this point, something in Shampoo snaps and the Amazon launches herself at the gymnast, bellowing- "Die Crazy Girl!"

Akane's eyes twitches as she watches the two battle, jumping from place to place leaving destruction in their wake. At this point, Akane finally had enough about this whole day. She just wants to go home and have a nice bath before dinner. Was that too much to ask?

Fuming at the two which suddenly had turn the into a fight with her as the prize again. She considers whether to leave Shampoo and head home first or settling the fight herself, then head back home.
1142212121221111211111112.title: No Breaks Anytime Soon: The Black Rose

11422121212211112111111121.content:
Deciding that she has enough of Nerima's chaos for today, Akane picks up the metal box that Shampoo has left on the ground and calls out to the Chinese girl, informing her that she's going home first and told her to find her when she's done.

Without waiting for a reply, Akane walks away and turns into the corner, bumping into someone.

"Ah, I'm sorry. I didn't see where I was going," Akane apologises and holds out her hand to pull the other up... to find that she actually knows this person. "Ukyo?"

"Hey sugar," the brunette answers, eyes darting around before meeting hers. "Nice evening, isn't it?"

"It's been a long day." At that, Akane sigh. Ukyo probably has it easier than her today. "How's things at the restaurant today?"

"Heh, about that." The chef visibly calms, even cracking a small smile. "There wasn't much customers today. Word is that Cat Cafe's new waitresses are rather close so I guess they were curious. They must be doing another event again.

Akane sweat drops. "Oh. Well, I guess."

"You know, I saw you walking back with Shampoo earlier," Ukyo places a hand on her chin, looking interested. "In fact, Kodachi's getting pretty close to you too."

"It's nothing like that!" Akane vehemently denies, her face in several shades of her namesake. "Kodachi must have eaten something bad and is hallucinating now. I wasn't even anywhere close to her for weeks!"

Ukyo's look turn curious. "You didn't say anything about Shampoo."

"I don't have anything to say about her." Akane turns away, not wanting to face the brunette. "And it's late, so I'm going home now. Bye."

With that said, she gives a short wave and quickly makes her way home. After all, there wasn't anything between them, right?

Right.

~~~~~

A couple of minutes later, without anymore interruptions, Akane makes it home. Exhausted, the Tendo sighs in relief when she got there, pushing the slide to get in and announced that she is home. She could imagine how nice the bath would feel after along day and had not notice the person kneeling at the front until-

"Welcome home," Ranma greets her from floor, a smile pulling on her lips daintily. "I have the bath ready for you when I heard that you're coming home."

Blinking, Akane just stares as the other gets up and holds out her hands. "I can help you take your bag upstairs if you want. There's clothes in there and um...." Ranma's gaze went downwards, hands wringing. "Kasami-san helped me take them down."

At this point, Akane doesn't know why she bothers trying to understand things anymore. Things haven't been the same ever since Ranma came.

But, Ranma did prepare the bath for her and he was thinking about her for once. Trying to help even when he's definitely not normal right now. She should probably thank him...

"I didn't want touch them," Ranma adds.

However, that thought was broken immediately with those words. Her fury ignites as she pulls out her mallet and glares sending him through the roof bellowing- "RANMA, YOU JERK!!!"

Still fuming with anger, she stomps away, heading for her room. She throws her bag onto her table and screams into her pillow, which helps a little. When she's a little calmer, she grabs her towel and leaves her room stopping a moment after she realises something.

Ranma's still a jerk.

Even when he's acting strange, he's still a jerk. In some part, Akane is a bit relief. At least some things doesn't change.

As she is about to walk to the bath, twin hazel eyes caught sight of Nabiki's nameplate. She had told her sister that she'll talk to her about this and the older sibling had sounded concerned to her ears.

11422121212211112111111121211.title: Partly works

1142212121221111211112.content:
Within the hour Shampoo waits for her beloved Master to return, she cleans the restaurant. Top to bottom until the dining area sparkles like a newly opened place. Nevertheless, with nothing to do after a minute, her jitters returns. Her twin maroon eyes often darting towards the direction with leads to the basement.

Although she has accepted her Master's proclamation of trust and relented from following her, Shampoo still worries. Great-grandmother is not someone to be taken lightly and from what Shampoo has seen, the elder does not approve. Therefore, it is with great caution that the young Amazon presses her ears onto the door to try and listen for any sound that would signal their arrival.

What she does not expect is to eavesdrop on an ongoing conversation.

"-remind you, young Tendo, that this might break the artifact's spell on Shampoo. If you are still offended, remember that this 'accident' is still partially your fault."

"You don't have to keep reminding me about it but she appeared out of nowhere and I already promised to help." Shampoo hears a loud exasperated huff. "It's just- I don't like that I have to be beaten by Shampoo. Isn't there another way? An Amazon secret that would help?"

"No." The firm tone only confirms that this is her great-grandmother. "Unless he 'shows his face again' as you put it, this is the only way. You have to let Shampoo beat you then the Student-Master ties would be broken."

And as the sound of hopping came closer, Shampoo quickly leaves. grabbing a cloth on the way to the dining area and starts wiping the table. Before long, Shampoo hears her Master's call.

"Shampoo? Are you here?" It is when the navy haired girl appears that everything in her world feels right again. Shampoo answers the call, dropping the cloth and approaches them.

"Master back." Then without hesitation, Shampoo wraps her arms around her Master, making sure that they were gentle. "Is very worry when no come back so long. Shampoo glad Master safe."

She hardly notices the sputters until her ears recognizes them. "S-Shampoo. Please let go of me. Now."

Reluctantly, she steps back but the lingering warmth from that brief touch brings a smile on her face.

"L-listen." Shampoo notes that her Master's voice is different somehow, and judging from what she had heard, it probably has something to do with that. Or she might have to cook a remedy for a sore throat. "I'm going to make a call. Could you just wait here? Just a few more minutes. I really need to talk to someone."

Her Master needn't explain herself. After all...

"Shampoo trust Master." Then, she gives a sad smile. "Is lonely but Shampoo know Master no leave without tell Shampoo."

"Shampoo..." A hand lands onto her shoulder, startling the Amazon as she looks up to sure brown oak eyes. "I did promise to help you. I will try. No matter how awkward it is." Another sigh. "Just five minutes more, okay?"

Slowly, Shampoo nods and only then did the bluenette leaves.

Now, with only her great-grandmother being the other person in the area, Shampoo contemplates whether to speak with the elder or not.
1142212121221111211112.title: Shampoo's POV

11422121212211112111121.content:
After Master's departure, Shampoo does her best not to make eye contact with her great grandmother. If it were possible, she didn't want to further distress her Master more than necessary since the elder woman does not approve of this new bond between them. The less arguments between the two closest to her the better.

However, it doesn't seem that the elder woman shares this thought.

"Shampoo." Cologne's tone is laced with discontent. "As I recall, I had trained and prepared you better than this. The pill's effect should have taken much longer before showing it's symptoms. Especially since Happy messed with it."

Shampoo remains silent.

"The young Tendo told me that you had immediately went under." At this, the elder Amazon shakes her head. "It seems I have much work cut for me once you returned to normal. Now, go and start preparing for the dinner hour." Shampoo was about to object when she was cut off. "Unless you rather go find Mousse to replace you tonight."

Seeing no other choice, Shampoo regards her great grandmother. "Shampoo go ask Master wait. Already five minutes no come back."

Then she leaves, feeling a pair of eyes on her back briefly before it vanishes. It doesn't take Shampoo long to reached the phone, her eyes catching the familiar hue of dark navy blue. Though as she opens her mouth to call out, her sharp ears picked up faint whimpers.

Worried, she approaches the area slowly, finding herself accidentally listening to another conversation.

"I really want to help them, Nabiki." The despair in her voice makes Shampoo winced. "Even Shampoo. But I just don't know how. Cologne doesn't know for sure and Oji-san is nowhere near here now. I just don't know what to do." As tears started rolling down her Master cheeks, Shampoo's willing her feet to move. "Nabiki onee-chan, please..."

A sharp pain strikes her chest as her Master's voice breaks.

"I need help."

The feeling becomes even worse when the bluenette fell to her knees, a palm closing her mouth as she struggles to keep her breath from hitching. The foreign girl may not understand much of Japanese customs, but she does know when someone is trying to be stronger than they actually are.

Her heart wrenches and aches to race over there.

However, what would she do? What can she do when the reason why her Master was crying is because of her?

Unable to take in the sight and the pain much longer, Shampoo finally found some courage to head over when a wooden staff blocks her way. Indecision plagues her as Cologne shakes her head and motions for her to follow. Her eyes keep lingering on the crying figure on the floor.

"Come child." It was stern and yet soft at the same time. "Give her more time."

With that said, Shampoo reluctantly follows her great grandmother downstairs and back into the kitchen where the two mostly worked in silence. Not even the pleading squawks manage to irk her as she continues prepping for the dinner hour.

Sometime later, Shampoo manages to finish and was about to leave when a metal box dangles in front of her face.

"Take it with you when you leave." Nodding, Shampoo grabs the box and found a few bamboo baskets within them. "Since you'll be staying there as her guest-" Cologne nods her head over to one of the table where her Master is sitting, her face slightly better than before. "-give them to the Tendo family."

Saying her thanks, Shampoo quickly heads out, hoping to find some way to cheer her Master up.
